intro: Brassaia cephalotes, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, featuring thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested, and its fruit is a three-lobed capsule containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
